text: So again, what is I can?
Je peux.
He can.
Il peut.
She can.
Elle peut.
You can.
Vous pouvez.
We can.
Nous pouvons.
They can.
Ils peuvent.
Again, students frequently struggle with they can.
And what I suggest is because it is also il, that they go back to he can and start off with that.
So he can is il peut.
Il peut.
And then you simply need to add a consonant sound to the end.
If you forget what the consonant sound is, you can find it in the middle of you can.
You can is of course vous pouvez.
And it has a V in the middle of pouvez.
So you add that V sound to the end of he can and you end up with ils peuvent, which means they can.
Now in French, we have you can, which of course is vous pouvez.
But there is a second way to say you can in French.
Unlike English, French has both a formal and informal form of address.
The vous form is the formal form of address, which French people use very widely, much more than perhaps we would imagine.
They perhaps use it with colleagues, with people they know, but not especially well.
Certainly people they meet in the street.
I've met very, very many students who have liked to use the informal form when it's inappropriate.
However, it's important to know this other form as well.
So to say you in the informal sense, it is tu.
And to say you can is tu peux.
So that will go with the I can, he can, she can.
So let's do those again.
What is I can?
Je peux.
He can.
Il peut.
She can.
Elle peut.
And you informal can.
Tu peux.
Now, students frequently struggle with the pronunciation of the informal you, which is tu.
This is because it actually has a pronunciation that doesn't really exist in English.
We often think we are familiar with it.
We think it simply sounds like the word tu, but it doesn't.
In order to pronounce it correctly, it is necessary to first round your lips as though you're going to whistle.
So you keep your lips rounded just as though you were going to whistle.
But instead of whistling, you're going to keep your lips rounded.
You're not going to move them, keep them very rounded.
And you're going to say t, as in the letter t, but with your lips rounded.
Okay.
Tu.
So again, you round your lips as though you're going to whistle.
You can perhaps whistle first and make a little whistling sound and go.
And then when you've done it and got the lips in the right position, you will then say the letter t whilst maintaining the lips in that position.
And you'll come out with tu.
So using that form, how would you say you can?
Tu pu.
It will come with practice.
And practice certainly does make perfect in this case.
Tu pu.
Tu pu.
Thank you.
